chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Robert Warner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Restitution Summary

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:21 pm 
State appears by Special Prosecutor Louis Molepski; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Amanda Ley. 
Date and time was set for status conference. 
State notes parties have reached an agreement and requests to proceed with plea hearing. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State files amended information. Reading waived. 
Atty Ley makes statement - def withdraws previous NGI pleas. 

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Criminal Trespass)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct. 2 (Operating a motor vehicle without owner's consent - joyriding)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct. 3 (Misd. Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct. 4 (Criminal Damage to Property)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
State makes statement. Atty Ley makes statement - notes restitution has been paid in full to J.H. and J.N. and only remaining restitution to be paid is the $1778.57 to West Bend Mutual Ins. Co. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: On Cts. 1-3>>9 months MCJ with huber to run concurrent to each other and consecutive to Ct. 4 with 203 days jail credit. 
                           : On Ct. 4>>57 days MCJ with huber to run consecutive to other counts with 41 days credit. 
COURT ORDERS payment of restitution of $1900 to J.H. and J.N. and $1778.57 to West Bend Mutual Ins. Co. with credit for any made payments. 
COURT ORDERS payment of court costs including 1 DNA surcharge. 
State requests def be transported to Newaygo County Jail by his father. 
COURT ORDERS def to report to Newaygo County Jail no later than Friday, April 24, 2015 by 5pm eastern time.

Case Called: 3:46pm. Clerk: Denise. Judge Knox Bauer appears by phone from Taylor County. State appears by Special Proescutor Louis Moepske in Marathon County. Deft appears in custody and by Atty Amanda Ley in Marathon County. Matter set for numerouse matters today. Crt proceeds withCompetency Hearing. Dr. Galli's Report on file. Dr. Galli states Defendant is competent. Defense stipulates to Defendant's competency to proceed. Crt finds Defendant is competent to proceed. Crt proceeds with Waiver of Prelim. Waiver of Prelim. filed.  Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  Information filed.  Reading Waived. Plea: Not Guilty by Reson Disease or Defect. Crt in receipt of Order for Examination under 971.16. Crt orders examination by WI Forensic Unit on outpatient basis for defendant. Report to be provided within 30 days 12/3/14. Crt to provide Order to Marathon County for filing by faxing today.  DATES: Review with Crt - 12/5/14 @ 11:30am - Special Prosecutor may appear by phone. CC: Susie. Adjourned: 3:53pm.
